Topic.Title: Blast in West, Texas

Message.Msg: 1. One survey of business executives has ranked California as the worst state in America to do business for 8 years in a row. 2. In 2011, the state of California ranked 50th out of all 50 states in new business creation. 3. According to one recent study, California is the worst-governed state in the entire country. 4. Thanks to Proposition 30, California now boasts the highest state income tax rate in the nation. 5. Even though California just raised taxes dramatically on the wealthy, state revenues are falling like a rock. State revenue for November 2012 was 10.8 percent below projections. 6. California has the highest sales tax rate in the United States. 7. California has the 8th highest corporate income tax rate in the country. 8. California has the highest “minimum corporate tax” in the country. Each corporation must pay at least $800 to the state even if a corporation does not make a single dollar of profit. 9. California is tied with New York for the highest gasoline tax rate and one of the highest gas prices in the country. 10. California is the only state in America that taxes carbon emissions. 11. The state of California issues some of the most expensive traffic tickets in the nation. 12. As of October,2012 only Nevada and Rhode Island had higher unemployment rates than California. The unemployment rate in California is more than 20 percent higher than the overall unemployment rate for the rest of the nation. 13. The state of California requires licenses for 177 different occupations (the most in the nation). The national average is only 92. 14. California teachers are the highest paid in the nation, but California students rank 48th in math and 49th in reading. 15. California accounts for 12 percent of the U.S. population, but a whopping 33 percent of Americans that receive TANF (Temporary Assistance for Needy Families) live there. 16. Only the state of Illinois has a lower bond rating than the state of California does.

Topic.Title: Blast in West, Texas

Message.Msg: 30. In Oakland, burglaries are up 43 percent so far this year. Oakland is considered the 5th most violent city in the United States. 31. There have been more than 250 gold chain robberies in Stockton, California just since the month of April. In Stockton, the police budget cuts got so bad that the police union put up a billboard at one point with the following message: “Welcome to the 2nd most dangerous city in California. Stop laying off cops.” 32. According to the U.S. Census Bureau, approximately 100,000 more people moved out of the state of California in 2011 than moved into it. 33. During 2011, more than 58,000 people moved from California to the state of Texas. 34. Overall, the state of California has experienced a net loss of about four million residents to other states over the past 20 years.

Topic.Title: The Children of Newtown are Ashamed of Republicans

Message.Msg: Actually I use an M1A (the "civilianized version" of the M14) as my primary hunting rifle. Admittedly i only use a 10 round box magazine, as a 20 round mag gets in the way more than it helps, but, oh, wait, I DO use an assault rifle on deer. My wife is worse, as she uses an M4 with a 30 round magazine. We also have bolt action Savage M10 Police tactical rifles for hunting deer at longer ranges. But you threw another of these indefinite negatives I've seen littering the gun debate, and I just thought I'd take a #$%$ on it. Just for you and the other super-libs, for next year I'll put a suppressor on it so the deer don't even get the luxury of knowing there the shot came from that dropped Bambi's mom, just before I my wife puts down Bambi's dad and my unloading rifle allows me a quick follow up shot on some of Bambi's other relatives before the herd realizes that they're numbers have been cut in half in less than 6 seconds.

For example: - you consider "simple humanity" to mean "protect the unborn" - I consider "simple humanity" that the FORTUNATE should protect the unfortunate, (yes - tax the wealthy - regardless how they got there to help the "unfortunate" - nobody CHOOSES to be unfortunate....) - for a BRIEF period of time certain country was systematically eradicating the disabled (physically or mentally) in the name of "simple humanity".... then they expanded it to certain ethnic group as well.... - for a LONG period of time "simple humanity" was to spread the word of Jesus Christ on the tip of a sword. Crusade was the word for it.... - to extremist of all kinds 'simple humanity' can easily mean to try to 'enlighten' the population to injustices in society, and do so through acts of terror.... - and so on - and so forth

Topic.Title: Finnaly a job Obama is quilified for.

Message.Msg: Any idiot can tell that was clipped from a photo caption, where articles are frequently skipped to save space when only a certain number of lines are allocated toward a caption. Journalism 101 don't ya know. So long ago that we had to set our type with a primitive pasteup board followed by photo duplication to "plates" (only photographic rather than acid etched metal). Wasn't quite as easy then as it was now to get space in the area where you needed it and not have some run over bump you and force a re-edit, so often articles were given very specific limits on allowed column inches. Some places still use those kinds of limits either because they have old school editors or people have realized overly worded or too short (data limited) captions have somewhere a happy medium between boring with material already in the article, and confusing due to a lack of information in the caption coupled with poor placement on the page.

Topic.Title: Chechen Islamist brothers were the Boston bombers

Message.Msg: May be media, especially news media, has to be extremely cautious with their reporting and not mangling or interpreting objective information from the field? But in your world, if they gave it to us 50% correct we should clap our hands. Good grief, 50% is half truth, and in old time it was translated as lie. "This crusade, this war on terrorism is going to take a while". This was one occasion when Bush used this word, just few days after horror of 9/11. And it was done when Afghanistan wasn't even in the picture. If you notice "crusade" and "war on terrorism" were used as synonyms. Now, if you poke the history, which you liberals are very reluctant to learn from, you will learn that crusaders were mere response ("jihad" in reverse) to bloody, cruel conquer of Europe by sword of Mohammad's army. So, you somehow link once used word to Afghanistan, although it was meant to be for a long time struggle, which we are still facing. Now, if there war in Afghanistan was a crusade, and our troops were crusaders in Bush era, why did Obama escalate it? Why is he still messing up with Islamic world by helping to remove Qaddafi? Did Bush force him? And what was 9/11 if not an act of jihad? What did Bush do in his first 6 months in power to anger Osama so much, that he decided to slaughter thousands and threatened to kill hundreds thousands if not millions? Just to pick on you....

Topic.Title: Chechen Islamist brothers were the Boston bombers

Message.Msg: Let's separate two actions. Shooting an abortion doctor privately (murder) and bombing his clinic (terrorism). The first affects only the bad actor, the second affects otherwise innocent people who may be in the area. So, from the standpoint of any typical Christian obviously the murder route would be preferable to the bombing route both because of the limited damage, the removal of the most important target, and the avoidance of loss of innocent life. So why do they use bombs and still call themselves Christians? Because the ones that use bombs aren't primarily Christians, they're primarily Terrorists without even alittle bit of Christian about them. The ones who shoot individual doctors with clean hits without anyone else put at risk are still murderers, but at least they can make some claim to being Christian murder's. In the entire history of people shooting or bombing abortion providers I've only ever seen ONE case where it MIGHT have been considered justifiable, and that only because that physician was going well over the lines of acceptable practices into outright homicide himself.

Message.Title: Our "Guvment" Continues to Fail Us!...
Message.Msg: WASHINGTON (AP) — Two U.S. officials briefed on the Boston marathon investigation say the Russian government contacted the FBI and the CIA separately in 2011 with concerns about Tamerlan Tsarnaev (tsahr-NEYE'-ehv), one of the men authorities say was behind the attacks. One of the officials says the CIA was contacted by Russia in the fall of 2011. Officials say Russia contacted the FBI in early 2011. The officials spoke on condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to speak publicly about the ongoing investigation. The FBI said its investigators found nothing to suggest Tsarnaev was part of an extremist group and shared that information back. Tsarnaev died in a police shootout.
